alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Coastal York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 16 at 3:42PM EST until January 17 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...A brief period of heavy snow expected before a change over to rain occurs. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Strong winds are also expected with gusts up to 60 mph. * WHERE...Coastal York and Coastal Cumberland Counties. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 1 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Roads will become snow covered and slippery. Intense snowfall rates will make for worse driving conditions than usual, and a switch to rain will make remaining snow covered roads even more slippery. Strong winds may cause power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heavy snowfall rates are anticipated, with rates of 1 to 3 inches per hour expected at times. The snow is then expected to change to rain during the late morning and early afternoon. Clogged storm drains may lead to ponding of water on roadways once precipitation changes to rain. Cold and windy conditions return Monday night and Tuesday with low wind chill values developing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to www.weather.gov/gray..
